title: 110_s1368
content: The Act may be cited as the "Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007" and outlines the authorities and duties of the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include limitations on Commission members' federal employee status, the acceptance of matching funds for projects, and personnel matters within the Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 (42 U.S.C. 3121 note; Public Law 105-277) is amended to include limitations on Commission members' federal employee status and the acceptance of matching funds for projects. Members not federal employees may waive compensation. Regulations for appointments are also revised. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include limitations on Commission members' federal employee status and the acceptance of matching funds for projects. Members not federal employees may waive compensation. Regulations for appointments are also revised, including the appointment and termination of necessary personnel. The Economic Development Committee section is also amended to change "shall" to "may" in certain instances. SEC. 3. SPECIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE DENALI COMMISSION. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include a training program for careers in infrastructure development in rural Alaska. The program focuses on construction, operations, maintenance, and management of Commission projects, as well as initiatives for Alaskan youths. Amounts allocated for the program remain available until used. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 includes initiatives for Alaskan youths to support Commission projects and training for infrastructure projects. Amounts allocated to the Commission remain available until expended. The Commission also provides assistance for teacher housing in rural Alaska, including housing development activities like acquisition, rehabilitation, and new construction. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2014. The effective date for the amendments is upon enactment of the Act, with the authorization of appropriations taking effect on October 1, 2008.
